intro: Wahlenbergia mannii var. intermedia, commonly known as the Intermediate Wahlenbergia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, linear leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Wahlenbergia mannii var. intermedia is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
